newsitem.title: SOUTH AFRICA: S.Africa's Winnie Mandela sells dirt from her past.
newsitem.headline: S.Africa's Winnie Mandela sells dirt from her past.

text.p: Winnie Madikizela-Mandela is selling bottles of soil for 50 rand ($11) from the house she shared with her former husband President Nelson Mandela in the 1950s, a South African newspaper said on Sunday.
The Sunday Times said each bottle came with a certificate of authenticity signed by Madikizela-Mandela and a history of the house in Africa's biggest township Soweto.

The former deputy minister, who was sacked from the position by her then husband in 1995, has turned the garage of her old home -- in the same neighbourhood as that of Truth Commission chairman Desmond Tutu -- into a thriving tourist attraction.
Traditional African ornaments such as necklaces, sculptures and masks are also on sale for up to 50 rand.

Zebeth Hlophe, who runs the attraction, told the Sunday Times about 100 people visited every day and that guided tours of the house, including the old bedroom of the president -- whom she divorced last year -- would probably start in June.
